title: 112_hr1171
content: The Marine Debris Act Amendments of 2012, also known as the Marine Debris Act, amends the Marine Debris Research, Prevention, and Reduction Act. It removes the words "Research, Prevention, and Reduction" from Section 1 and updates the purpose outlined in Section 2. Section 2 (33 U.S.C. 1951) is amended to address the adverse impacts of marine debris on the U.S. economy, marine environment, and navigation safety through identification, prevention, reduction, and removal of marine debris. NOAA Marine Debris Program is established. The program under Section 3 (33 U.S.C. 1952) is amended to identify, assess, prevent, reduce, and remove marine debris, with a focus on the economy of the United States. A conforming amendment is made to Section 7 (33 U.S.C. 1956). The program under Section 3 (33 U.S.C. 1952) is amended to identify, assess, prevent, reduce, and remove marine debris, with a focus on marine debris posing a threat to living marine resources and navigation safety. The Administrator will provide national and regional coordination to assist in these efforts, including addressing the impacts of lost and discarded fishing gear on marine resources and navigation safety. The program aims to research alternatives and methods for marking gear to enhance tracking and recovery, develop nonregulatory measures to reduce lost fishing gear, and educate the public on marine debris sources and prevention. The Marine Plastic Pollution Research and Control Act of 1987 is being repealed, including grant criteria and guidelines amendments. This is part of efforts to address marine debris and its impacts on the economy, environment, and navigational safety through public-private initiatives. SEC. 6 of the Marine Plastic Pollution Research and Control Act of 1987 repeals obsolete provisions by amending Section 4. SEC. 7 makes amendments to definitions. The Interagency Marine Debris Coordinating Committee is restructured and moved to the Marine Debris Research, Prevention, and Reduction Act. A clerical amendment repeals the item related to section 2203. Biennial progress reports are redesignated and amended under the new structure. The Interagency Marine Debris Coordinating Committee is restructured and moved to the Marine Debris Research, Prevention, and Reduction Act. Biennial Progress Reports are now required, with amendments to the reporting process. SEC. 8. CONFIDENTIALITY OF SUBMITTED INFORMATION amended by removing "by the fishing industry". SEC. 9. MARINE DEBRIS DEFINITION updated to include a definition of marine debris as any solid material disposed of in the marine environment. SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS amended to authorize appropriations through fiscal year 2015.
